name: Redis-s-expression
body:
### redis-s-expression

## Go Native on Values in Redis with Clojure
Redis only allows string values in its store. So we write those values as Clojure s-expressions. We `read` them with the Clojure reader.

## Presentation at Clojure.mn

I did a short presentation at [Clojure.mn](http://clojure.mn/) on March 7th, 2012 on this project. The slides are available via the following link: [Redis S-Expressions Presents at Clojure.mn](http://tinyurl.com/redis-s-expression)
tagline: A layer on redis-clojure library allowing homoiconic persistence in Redis
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
